subject: Re: [junit] getting full error message when doing asserEquals?
msgSnippet: Arny, Sorry for the ridiculously late reply, but in case someone else finds this in the archives, I believe that the error message has been much better since
messageBody:
Arny,

Sorry for the ridiculously late reply, but in case someone else finds
this in the archives, I believe that the error message has been much
better since JUnit 3.8.2.

David Saff

On Thu, Feb 28, 2008 at 5:33 AM, arny1934 <arny1934@...> wrote:
> hi,
>
> i wonder how i can get "full" error message, when an assertEquals fails,
> e.g. in my test i have:
> assertEquals("someText", "someOtherText");
>
> when running the junit test, the test output says:
> [junit] Testcase: testOne(com.SomeTest): FAILED
> [junit] expected:<......> but was:<...Other...>
> [junit] junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: expected:<......> but
> was:<...Other...>
>
>
> how can I get junit to say "expected:<someText> but
> was:<someOtherText>" instead of all the dots (.....) ?
>
> My junit ant task is below:
>
> <target name="test" depends="build_test">
> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="yes" fork="true">
> <classpath refid="classpath.test" />
> <formatter type="brief" usefile="false" />
> <formatter type="xml" />
> <batchtest todir="${junit_reports}">
> <fileset dir="${build_test}" includes="**/*Test.class" />
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
